sub_title: Senior Scientist Stem Cell Biology at Ncardia
summary: Self-directed and driven Stem Cell scientist with twelve years of experience in cardiovascular and stem cell research. Achieved success with peer-reviewed publications, illustrating a strong scientific background and recognition from the scientific community. Highly organized and creative problem solver. Experienced in developing and executing complex protocols and research projects.

courses.name: Teaching in relationship to your research
Teaching to students to do research in STEM

profile_positions.description:
• Project leader in stem cell process development and manufacturing for organ regeneration.
• Execution of iPSC-derived cell manufacturing projects and processing development to manufacturing and characterization of new hiPSC-derived cell models.
• Project acquisition and project management.
profile_positions.title: Senior Scientist Stem Cell Biology

profile_positions.description:
Established a model to study the effect of genetic mutations on cardiac disease. 
• Differentiated IPSCs from control and patients into: 
                     - Atrial and ventricular cardiomyocytes
                     - Cardiac fibroblasts
                     - Endothelial cells
                     - Skeletal muscle
                     - Macrophages
• Generated 3D cardiac organoids to study the effects of air pollution on cardiovascular disease
• Mentoring
profile_positions.title: Research Faculty

profile_positions.description:
Variant to gene mapping to uncover causal gene(s) for Alzheimer’s disease.
•	Studied changes in chromatin conformation in resting and activated microglia using chromatin capture assay and next-generation sequencing to identify candidate genes
•	Derived terminally differentiated neurons, astrocytes, and microglia from induced pluripotent stem cells
•	Performed functional studies using CRISPR/cas9 on differentiated neurons
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Research Scientist

profile_positions.description:
Developed a novel approaches for the treatment of cardiac arrhythmias.
•	Developed atrial and ventricular cardiomyocytes from induced pluripotent stem cells derived from arrhythmia patients
•	Studied mutated ion channels by patch-clamp 
•	Evaluated changes in calcium dynamics using confocal microscopy and Ionoptix
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Fellow

profile_positions.description:
Electrophysiologic Characterization of Calcium Handling in Human Induced  Pluripotent Stem Cell-Derived Atrial Cardiomyocytes
•	Differentiated induced pluripotent stem cells to atrial and nodal cardiomyocytes
•	Developed a model of atrial fibrillation in patient-specific stem cell-derived cardiomyocytes
•	Compared the electrophysiology and calcium dynamics of derived cardiomyocytes to determine arrhythmogenicity
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow

company.name: UNIVERSIDAD NACIONAL DE GENERAL SAN MARTIN (UNSAM)

profile_positions.description:
Teaching assistant, Biology I, Biology III and Introductory Biology 		         
•	Planned course syllabus to inform students of material assignments and course requirements
•	Teach classes according to need and schedule
•	Prepare curriculum for general courses and programs
•	Meet with students regarding their academic goals and how to meet them
•	Communicate with other professors regarding specific programs and how to better them
•	Conduct research into specific areas of study and implement new information into curriculum when possible
profile_positions.title: Teaching Assistant (TA)

profile_positions.location: INTI - Instituto Nacional de Tecnología Industrial
profile_positions.description:
Androgenic control of cardiac action potential in a murine model of Brugada syndrome
•	Evaluate the effect of testosterone on arrhythmias in animal models
•	Perform sharp microelectrode electrophysiology to asses changes in cardiac electricity 
•	Examine changes at protein and RNA level in animals treated with testosterone and estrogens
profile_positions.title: CONICET Ph.D. Student

profile_positions.description:
Postgraduate course, biotechnology of animal reproduction and in vitro fertilization. 
•	Teach courses weekly
•	Prepare materials and laboratory curricula
•	Maintain credentials as required by accrediting councils/agencies and regulatory bodies
•	Keep inventory and order material for laboratory practices
profile_positions.title: Teaching and Laboratory Assistant

profile_positions.location: Merced y alrededores, California, Estados Unidos
profile_positions.description:
Role of Calsequestrin and Sorcin in the regulation of cardiac excitation-contraction coupling
•	Perform experiments in perfused mouse whole heart and isolated cells from mutant mice
•	Apply Pulse Local Field Fluorescence Microscopy (PLFFM) to study single cell calcium and action potentials
profile_positions.title: Junior Specialist

company.name: UNIVERSIDAD NACIONAL DE GENERAL SAN MARTIN (UNSAM)

profile_positions.description:
Hormonal control of Kv4.3 channel in Brugada Syndrome
•	Generate a drug model of Brugada syndrome to explore novel therapies for the disease
•	Study the effect of testosterone in a mouse model of Brugada syndrome
•	Assess the molecular changes in the potassium channel Kv4.3
